intro: Brassia hexodonta, commonly known as the six-toothed orchid, is a species native to Central and South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its intricate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white with distinctive, elongated sepals and petals. Brassia hexodonta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
